messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Re: UNC-CH     re Clones
messages.msgSnippet: Dear Pam........actually a clone or two of your might be a good thing!  The world could use a few more of you. Sharon Pam Hartley
messages.messageBody:
Dear Pam........actually a clone or two of your might be a good thing! The world could use a few more of you.
Sharon
Pam Hartley <pamhartley@...> wrote:

I am,
apparently, some sort of cloning experiment gone horribly wrong. <gg>


Pam, mom to croupy three year old

>people tell me they know someone who sounds/behaves exactly like I do. I
am,

Then you may enjoy the novels of Lois McMasters Bujold about Miles

messages.subject: Re: UNC-CH (was Dogs and Biting)
messages.msgSnippet: ... is.  Thanks for making me feel old, Pam ;-).  UNC-CH is the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill, the place where I did all the things that will
messages.messageBody:
> I was 15 to 18 between 1980 and 1984, and don't know what UNC-CH
is. <g>

Thanks for making me feel old, Pam ;-). UNC-CH is the University of
North Carolina at Chapel Hill, the place where I did all the things
that will keep me from ever running for political office. Well,
maybe I wasn't that bad ...

Pam Hartley was my best friend my freshman year of college. I knew
it was a long shot, but thought I'd throw out the question.

Hope your croupy 3yo feels better!

Amy

messages.subject: Re: UNC-CH (was Dogs and Biting)
messages.msgSnippet: ... I was 15 to 18 between 1980 and 1984, and don t know what UNC-CH is.  So, no, I don t think so, and, what is UNC-CH? (I ll play game show contestent
messages.messageBody:
----------
>From: Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com
>To: Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com
>Subject: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest Number 1295
>Date: Fri, Jun 8, 2001, 2:39 AM
>

> Did you happen to attend UNC-CH between 1980 and
> 1984?


I was 15 to 18 between 1980 and 1984, and don't know what UNC-CH is. <g> So,
no, I don't think so, and, what is UNC-CH? (I'll play game show contestent
though: "Uh, 'University of North Carolina, Charlotte?" Now you say, "No!
You ARE the Weakest Link! Goodbye!" ;)

I am often being mistaken/thought of for other people, though. Lots of
people tell me they know someone who sounds/behaves exactly like I do. I am,
apparently, some sort of cloning experiment gone horribly wrong. <gg>

Okay, I admit it, I didn't get enough sleep.

Pam, mom to croupy three year old
